page.title: 07WHITE HALL
page.content:
{WHITE HALL AT WINESTEAD}
White Hall was built in 1815 at a cost of Â£14,000.00 It is a Grade II listed building occupying 100 acres of land. There are 22 rooms, the library being of great interest with its three walls of very old books with four corner sections reminiscent of the Brighton Pavilion. This room has not been decorated since 1870. There are two lodges connected with White Hall named as the Main Lodge and Lane Lodge. There are only two part-time staff employed now. Close by the house are Ilix trees which is unusual as these are not normally found so far North. Four hundred Elm trees have had to be destroyed because of Dutch Elm disease.
